usa: Jack Ruby died of a pulmonary embolism at Parkland Hospital, where Oswald had died and where President Kennedy had been pronounced dead after his assassination.<sup id="cite_ref-394" class="reference">[394]</sup>
Operation Cedar Falls, the largest ground operation of the Vietnam War, began; with over 500,000 with the number of U.S. troops totaling more than 500,000 by the end of 1967.[395][396]
Super Bowl I: In the first Super Bowl took place between the Green Bay Packers and the Kansas City Chiefs.[397]

The Twenty-fifth Amendment to the United States Constitution, establishing succession to the Presidency and procedures for filling a vacancy in the office of the Vice President, was ratified.<sup id="cite_ref-398" class="reference">[398]</sup>
The United States Department of Transportation was established.<sup id="cite_ref-399" class="reference">[399]</sup>

National Mobilization Committee to End the War in Vietnam: 400,000 demonstrators march in New York City from Central Park to the United Nations Headquarters against the Vietnam War; with 100,000 protesting the war in San Francisco, being one of the largest demonstrations against the Vietnam War.[400]
The Summer of Love took place, marking a defining period for the counterculture movement in the U.S.[401][402]
Loving v. Virginia: The Supreme Court overruled the prohibition of interracial marriage.[403]
American Samoa became self-governing under a new Constitution.<sup id="cite_ref-404" class="reference">[404]</sup>
Thurgood Marshall was sworn in as an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court; becoming the first African-American Justice to serve on the court.<sup id="cite_ref-405" class="reference">[405]</sup>
